author:
Esther Gross
Journal Staff Writer
title: Latin American Film Festival brings movies from all over to R.I. - Entertainment & Life
text: The Providence Latin American Film Festival kicks off tonight with "Buscando a Gaston" ("Finding Gaston"), a documentary about chef Gaston Acurio of Peru. It will be shown at 7 p.m. at the University of Rhode Island Feinstein Providence Campus, on Washington Street. The festival continues through Sunday with screenings at URI in Providence, Bryant University in Smithfield, and the Warwick Public Library of films from Guatemala, Paraguay, Spain, Argentina, Mexico and Puerto Rico. This year, the festival celebrates the 100th birthday of Mexican-born Anthony Quinn, who spent the last years before his death in 2001 living in Bristol. "Viva Zapata," the 1952 film for which Quinn won the Oscar for Best Supporting Actor, will be shown Friday at 7 p.m. at URI and Saturday at 6 p.m. at Bryant University. Each screening will be followed by a panel discussion. For a full schedule, go to www.plaff.org .
